# Key Terms and Definitions {.unnumbered}

**Accessibility** - The ease and conditions under which statistical information can be obtained.

**Accuracy** - The closeness of computations or estimates to the unknown exact or true values that the statistics were intended to measure.

**Administrative data** - Data sets created primarily for administrative purposes by government agencies or other entities working on behalf of the government.

**Big Data** - Large, complex datasets characterized by high volume, velocity, variety, and sometimes veracity, requiring advanced analytical methods.

**Citizen Generated Data (CGD)** - Data produced by citizens, communities, and civil society organizations through various means including surveys, mapping, and monitoring activities.

**Clarity** - The extent to which easily comprehensible metadata are available to give full understanding of statistical data.

**Coherence** - The adequacy of statistics to be combined in different ways and for different uses.

**Consistency** - Statistics having logical and numerical coherence.

**Data Controller** - An entity that determines the purposes and means of processing personal data.

**Data Protection** - The practice of safeguarding important data from corruption, compromise, or loss.

**Data Quality Assessment Framework (DQAF)** - A systematic approach to assessing the quality of statistical data.

**Data Subject** - An individual who is the subject of personal data.

**Dissemination** - The release and distribution of statistical information to users.

**Elements to be Assured** - Good practices that support the implementation of quality principles and requirements.

**External Assessment** - Quality evaluation conducted by independent parties outside the producing organization.

**Fit for Purpose** - The concept that statistical data should be appropriate and of necessary standards for their intended use.

**Generic Statistical Business Process Model (GSBPM)** - An international standard that provides a framework for the production of official statistics.

**Generic Activity Model for Statistical Organizations (GAMSO)** - A framework that describes the activities of statistical organizations.

**Impartiality** - The principle of producing statistics without bias or political interference.

**Implementation** - The process of putting KeSQAF principles and requirements into practice.

**Institutional Environment** - The organizational and legal context within which statistical activities are conducted.

**Integrity** - Values and related practices that maintain confidence in the eyes of users in the agency producing statistics.

**Inter-Agency Statistics Committee (IaSC)** - The apex coordinating body for Kenya's National Statistical System.

**Kenya Strategy for Development of Statistics (KSDS)** - The national strategic framework for statistics development in Kenya.

**Kenya Statistical Quality Assurance Framework (KeSQAF)** - The national framework for ensuring quality in official statistics production.

**Metadata** - Data that provides information about other data, including concepts, definitions, and methodologies.

**Methodological Soundness** - The extent to which the methodology used to compile statistics complies with relevant international standards.

**Microdata** - Individual records or observations from statistical surveys or censuses.

**National Quality Working Group (NQWG)** - The NSS-wide body providing support for quality assurance implementation.

**National Statistical Office (NSO)** - The principal statistical agency in a country (KNBS in Kenya).

**National Statistical System (NSS)** - The ensemble of statistical organizations and units within a country that jointly collect, process and disseminate official statistics.

**Non-Response** - The failure to obtain measurements on some units selected for a statistical survey.

**Official Statistics** - Statistics disseminated by the statistical offices of a state or by other agencies of a state.

**Outlier** - An observation that deviates significantly from other observations in a dataset.

**Paradata** - Data about the data collection process itself.

**Peer Review** - Quality assessment conducted by professionals from similar organizations.

**Population Frame** - A list, map, or other specification of units in the population from which a sample may be selected.

**Principle** - A fundamental quality standard that guides statistical activities.

**Professional Independence** - The ability to develop, produce, and disseminate statistics without political or other inappropriate interference.

**Punctuality** - The time lag between the actual delivery of the data and the target date when it should have been delivered.

**Quality** - A multidimensional concept referring to the degree to which a set of inherent characteristics fulfils requirements.

**Quality Assessment** - The systematic evaluation of statistical quality using various tools and methods.

**Quality Assurance** - All planned and systematic activities implemented to provide adequate confidence that statistics will satisfy quality requirements.

**Quality Control** - The operational techniques and activities used to fulfill requirements for quality.

**Quality Indicator** - A quantitative or qualitative measure used to assess quality performance.

**Quality Management** - Coordinated activities to direct and control an organization with regard to quality.

**Quality Manual** - A document specifying the quality management system of an organization.

**Quality Policy** - Overall intentions and direction of an organization related to quality.

**Quality Report** - A document that provides information about the quality of statistical outputs.

**Reliability** - The closeness of the initial estimated value to the subsequent estimated value.

**Relevance** - The degree to which statistical information meets the real or perceived needs of clients.

**Requirement** - A specific condition that must be met to satisfy a quality principle.

**Respondent** - An individual, household, or organization that provides data for statistical purposes.

**Respondent Burden** - The effort required by respondents to participate in statistical data collection.

**Revision** - A change in previously published statistical data.

**Risk Management** - The systematic identification, assessment, and management of potential threats to quality.

**Sampling Error** - The error that arises from using a sample to estimate population parameters.

**Self-Assessment** - Quality evaluation conducted internally by the producing organization.

**Statistical Business Process** - The set of activities involved in producing official statistics.

**Statistical Confidentiality** - The protection of confidential data related to individual units that are obtained directly for statistical purposes or indirectly from administrative sources.

**Statistical Data and Metadata Exchange (SDMX)** - An international standard for exchanging statistical data and metadata.

**Statistical Disclosure Control** - Methods used to prevent the identification of individual respondents in statistical outputs.

**Statistical Production** - The entire process of creating official statistics from design to dissemination.

**Statistical Register** - A structured list of statistical units maintained for statistical purposes.

**Statistical Unit** - An entity about which information is sought and statistics are compiled.

**Stakeholder** - Any individual, group, or organization that can affect or is affected by statistical activities.

**Standard** - A technical specification or precise criteria designed to ensure consistency and quality.

**Time Series** - A sequence of data points collected at regular time intervals.

**Timeliness** - The length of time between data availability and the event or phenomenon they describe.

**Transparency** - The principle that policies and practices should be clearly documented and made public.

**UN Fundamental Principles of Official Statistics (UNFPOS)** - Ten principles adopted by the UN Statistical Commission to guide the work of statistical agencies.

**UN National Quality Assurance Framework (UN-NQAF)** - The international framework upon which KeSQAF is based.

**User** - Any individual or organization that uses official statistics.

**User Needs** - The requirements and expectations of statistical users.

**Validation** - The process of checking the accuracy and quality of data.

**Variable** - A characteristic or attribute that can be measured or observed.
